meanings.definition: A hole or pit in a road surface caused by wear or weathering.
meanings.sent1: The chuckholes on the road made driving very bumpy.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to drive into the chuckholes on this street.
meanings.sent3: The chuckholes on the road seemed to play hide and seek with the tires.
meanings.sent4: Avoiding the chuckholes felt like navigating a minefield.
meanings.sent5: The chuckholes were like hungry mouths waiting to swallow the car tires.

meanings.definition: To make a hole or holes in (a road surface) by wear or weathering.
meanings.sent1: The heavy rain can quickly chuckholes in the dirt road.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the constant traffic can chuckholes in the pavement.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids decided to chuckholes in the sand with their shovels.
meanings.sent4: The old pickaxe chucked holes in the rocky ground effortlessly.
meanings.sent5: The workers had to fill the chuckholes to prevent accidents on the road.
